intro: Talauma papuana, commonly known as the Papuan talauma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Talauma papuana is considered a rare and endangered species.
